question: What is the 2024 standard deduction for Single filers (or Married filing separately)?
What is the 2024 standard deduction for Married filing jointly (or Qualifying surviving spouse)?
What is the 2024 standard deduction for Head of household?
For purposes of the higher standard deduction, when are you considered to reach age 65?
If you file Married filing separately and your spouse itemizes deductions, can you take the standard deduction?
What percentage of AGI do medical expenses have to exceed before you can deduct them (Schedule A)?
Is cosmetic surgery deductible as a medical expense?
ground_truth: No, unless it is necessary to improve a deformity from a congenital abnormality, injury, or disfiguring disease.

question: When deducting lodging as a medical expense, what is the maximum per night per person you can include (when it otherwise qualifies)?
Are prescription medicines and insulin generally includable as medical expenses?
For the Child and Dependent Care Credit, what is the dollar limit of expenses you can use if you had one qualifying person at any time during the year?
For the Child and Dependent Care Credit, what is the dollar limit of expenses you can use if you had two or more qualifying persons?
For the Child and Dependent Care Credit, your usable expenses cannot be more than what income limit (if you are married at end of year)?
ground_truth: The smaller of your or your spouse's earned income.

question: If you prepay dependent care expenses before care is provided, which year do you count them in?
ground_truth: The year the care is received (not the year you paid).

question: If your employer reimburses dependent care expenses under a dependent care assistance program, can you also count those reimbursed expenses for the credit?
What form must the custodial parent generally use to release the claim so the noncustodial parent can claim certain child-related tax benefits?
ground_truth: Form 8332 (or a similar statement with the same required info).

question: For a post-2008 divorce decree/separation agreement, can the noncustodial parent attach pages from the decree instead of Form 8332?
Does Form 8332 transfer eligibility for earned income credit, dependent care credit, or head of household filing status?
Can the Form 8332 release be set for one year, specific years, or all future years?
ground_truth: Yes (it can be any of those).

question: In the estimated-tax safe harbor example, if your prior-year AGI is more than $150,000, what prior-year percentage is used in the comparison?
ground_truth: 110% of the prior-year tax (for the prior-year option).

question: In that same safe-harbor framework, what current-year percentage is used in the comparison?
What are the standard IRS estimated tax payment due dates for the four payment periods (before weekend/holiday adjustments)?
ground_truth: April 15, June 15, September 15, January 15 (of the following year for the last period).

question: How much home-sale gain can you generally exclude if you qualify and you are not filing jointly?
How much home-sale gain can you generally exclude if you qualify and you are Married filing jointly?
For a qualifying surviving spouse scenario in Pub 523, what is one key time requirement to use the $500,000 exclusion after a spouse's death?
ground_truth: Sell the home within 2 years of the spouse's death (and meet the listed conditions).

question: For a charitable contribution of $250 or more, what documentation do you generally need from the organization to claim a deduction?
ground_truth: A contemporaneous written acknowledgment (or certain payroll deduction records).

question: When determining whether your contribution is $250 or more, can you combine multiple small separate contributions?
ground_truth: No - do not combine separate contributions.

question: For EIC, what is the maximum investment income allowed (per Pub 596 2025 rules list)?
For EIC, what earned-income ceiling is listed for three or more qualifying children (with valid SSNs), Single/HOH/etc. (not MFJ)?
For EIC, what earned-income ceiling is listed for one qualifying child (valid SSN), Single/HOH/etc. (not MFJ)?
What is the maximum American Opportunity Tax Credit per eligible student (Pub 970, 2024 rules)?
ground_truth: $2,500 maximum annual credit per eligible student.
